text:
Hi Mo, I want to apologise profusely for not getting back to you sooner, we had a system update at work, and I lost access to the space.
How did it end up going? How was you film?

So, to get back into the swing of things, I'm going to track down some useful links for you of animators/teachers/persons of interest, that I like to listen to, or study when I'm working:
<https://www.youtube.com/user/nplus1> (provides feedback on people's personal shots)
<https://vimeo.com/richardlico> has a lot of tutorials on his website that talk about different uses for tools he has made, these rely on world based co-ordinates

<https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8y8EbsGuX5M&list=PLUXOZBYo_-RVUdL8tzr8oMZKNLMW5G0Le> keith lango released all his video tutorials recently, and although old, the principles are still great to learn
